page.title: 13West Blatchington Windmill
page.content: West Blatchington Windmill built in 1724 was the focal point of the countryside consisting of a few farm buildings,trees,grass and a pond and although the mill has changed very little the surrounding area is now mostly urban. The 3 storey wooden windmill,with its revolving cap, 4 sails and circular windows is both a tower & a smock mill built on a flint and brick barn. It was used for grinding, powering the chaff cutters & also the threshing machines and later on as a smugglers store and was a well known landmark for sailors. The windmill stopped work in 1907 and in1928 was bought by Hove Corporation, who,along with the National Trust have preserved the building since. The farm buildings and barn are no longer there and the mill is open for the public.
